article.headline: San Diego 78, UC Riverside 62
article.story: SAN DIEGO (AP) -- Gyno Pomare scored a career-high 22 points to lead San Diego to a 78-62 win over UC Riverside Wednesday night, extending the Highlanders' losing streak to 12 games. San Diego (10-6) took control in the second half as it increased a 32-30 halftime lead to 58-45. The Toreros hit 14 of 15 free throws in the first eight minutes of the half. San Diego, which was 3-for-6 from the line in the first half, finished making 26 of 35 free throws. UC Riverside (3-14) extended its own Division I record losing streak and is four losses shy of tying the school record of 16 set in 1954-55. The Highlanders' losing streak began with a 79-45 loss Nov. 21 at San Diego State. Pomare fell one short of tying his career high with 13 rebounds. Nir Cohen added 13 points for the Toreros, who have lost two straight. Chris Johnson led UC Riverside with 21 points and Larry Cunningham had 15. San Diego coach Brad Holland missed the game due to an unspecified family matter, said school spokesman Ted Gosen.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
